data.title: Godot ignores sequential camera rotations in 3d.
data.body:
In my project I have 2 camera rotations in a row. Godot will execute the first one and ignore all the rest for that frame.

Godot Version: Godot_v2.0_alpha_20151030_win64.exe
Os: Windows 7 Pro 12GB
Gfx: Radeon R9 270x 2GB x2 no crossfire
Driver: Radeon Crimson 15.12

The entire project:
https://mega.nz/#!9QlyFAzZ!uYYmrc4C3kia1MMG5ZRCME_p2h_bVsFqNrMuC0aUO9k
Just the code:
https://gist.github.com/Einlander/4a408e91679d32a9c063

data.title: Avast anti-virus blocks Godot in some cases
data.body:
Avast keeps detecting Godot as some sort of hacking device, in order to reproduce all i have to do is run the engine, export a build, run the build.(while the engine is running)
It also did it once i ran the engine the first time.
However if i close the engine and run only the build it runs fine.(mostly)
But these sorts of cases are a warning, what is the average user gonna think?
So maybe there is something to look into, or at least users should be foretold of this issue with Avast(and maybe other anti-viruses?).

data.title: Image resizing not working as intended
data.body:
A simple idea, one set of sprites, and in order to generate an sd version of your game all you do is reduce the sprites by 2(half) export the new set and be happy. That's not how things work though.

Today i tested the image resizing exports, again this is **on 2.0rc1**, basically **resizing the individual images** doesn't work. However **resizing them once you export them in an atlas**, that does work, but it does that in a way that leaves questions... 

You can see the black borders in the picture(the orig tex were 32x32 btw), I'm guessing it has to do with the way atlasses are handled. Also one thing that i was thinking, lets say i resize my images in half, whats gonna happen with the actual objects in the game?
Do i have to do further maintenance to get it to work, will the distances now be twice as large, what about objects and speed?
There isnt a doc on the subject, supporting sd/hd/xhd etc, seems to be quite possible with godot, maybe its just not polished yet.

Again, with the atas export, i dont know what '_default_' is, vs. '_keep original_'. but it  seems keep original takes less ram when running... maybe just an impression...
![resizing](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10463922/12977675/59602ae2-d0b3-11e5-9ff6-08d0b15ab429.png)

data.title: Filesystem can show duplicated subfolders after creating new folder
data.body:
Like the title says after doing that the contents of res appeared also, and in a strange fashion(as links? not sure) inside the new folder. and the res registered 2 folders.
After restarting everything was normal again. But this leads me to another issue, there isnt really an option to create a new folder, in the Filesystem window.

This was all using 2
![saved script and created new folder](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10463922/12968825/53a92842-d05e-11e5-8127-09b4013833d4.png)
.0rc1 of course.

data.title: The Better Collada addon puts all the code in one file, is this a good idea?
data.body:
Noting the recent discussion elsewhere regarding the Collada situation with Blender, I took a quick look at the code for the Better Collada addon and found that much of the code is in a file nearly 2000 lines long. I'm not really sure if that is such a good idea for the following reasons...
- It becomes harder to maintain
- It becomes more prone to bugs
- It becomes more difficult to add functionality
- It's more difficult to find certain pieces of code

I think in a sense, it would really help the cause of pushing the new exporter if the code can at least, as a start, be split into different files where possible (so as to organize everything and make it easier to maintain/expand/fix). One example would be the common case of defining your functions in one file for use in another.

Just something to think about.

data.title: fix blackberry compilation
data.body: And it even runs (on a z10) ^^

data.title: ParticleSystem crashes Godot if Amount > Max
data.body:
If the 'amount' attribute in a particle system is equal or higher than the maximum (1024) Godot crashes instantly.
The inspector should not allow the user to input numbers higher than the maximum.

Affects 3d only, in 2D the inspector limits the number at 1024

data.title: doc: use correct identifiers for InputEventJoystick{Motion, Button}
data.body: fixes #3655

data.title: Fixed a couple of tooltips on the editor
data.body: There was just a simple copy-paste mistake which gave some buttons a wrong tooltip or no tooltip at all.

data.title: WorldEnvironment with stretch_mode = viewport and mode = keep bugs
data.body:
### Steps to replicate
1. open to "HDR for 2D" in edit mode
2. go to `Project Settings`, set `stretch_mode` to `viewport` set `width` and `height` to some values greater than your screen resolution (I set mine to 1920x1080)
3. run "game"

I get [this image](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/40341257/godot/godot_environ_bug01.png) which is a bug, those stretchy things on the right side shouldn't exist.

![godot_environ_bug01](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4701338/12959903/de0cbc4a-d038-11e5-8e29-a119eaef06e8.png)

Also, if `mode` is set to `Keep` in the `Environment` resource, the editor goes crazy [like so](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/40341257/godot/godot_environ_bug02.png)... By the way, I have no idea what this `mode` property does... I was just fulling around.

![godot_environ_bug02](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4701338/12959907/e136d81a-d038-11e5-954b-90d726309aac.png)

data.title: InputEventJoystick{Motion,Button} are documented as InputEvent*Joy*{Motion,Button}
data.body:
Likely a typo :) @Hinsbart 

```
$ ack JoyMotion
tools/doc/doc_data.cpp
436:                                    "","Key","MouseMotion","MouseButton","JoyMotion","JoyButton","ScreenTouch","ScreenDrag","Action"

core/os/input_event.cpp
110:                    str+= "Event: JoyMotion ";

modules/gdscript/gd_editor.cpp
2327:                                                           "# JoyMotion",

doc/base/classes.xml
14205:<class name="InputEventJoyMotion" category="Built-In Types">
```

data.title: ByteArray and FloatArray are not exposed to the documentation
Atlas lossy quality slider on IMG group needs numerical identifier
data.body:
![atlas-imggroup](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10463922/12956678/4f0f09ee-d010-11e5-86c0-0e3e1d153946.png)

You cant tell the quality in a numerical fashion, unlike in any other instance where the slider shows up, across the editor.
It could follow the same approach done all over, of having a number and arrows with it, or in this case, simply a tools when you hover over with the current value would do.

Personally i'd prefer the std way to be used, for the sake of cohesiveness.

Also, what in the world is "Default" for compress mode? That's not specified in the docs, not that i found anyways, maybe it should be added to the docs so people will know.

data.title: Editor Crash when setting subscene with Control root as a placeholder
data.body:
Tested on Ubuntu in 595de75641e0fae1f4e6924530da7a3308371a07 build.
1. Open new scene. 
2. Put Control node inside.
3. Save scene as "subscene.tscn"
4. Open new scene, put "Node" as a root. 
5. Save the scene as "main.tscn"
6. Instance "subscene.tscn" into main scene.
7. In inspector set subscene to "load as placeholder"
8. Do "ctrl + s" to save main scene.
9. Editor will crash.

Sample project in which you need to set subscene as placeholder and save: 
[ControlPlaceholderCrash.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/125262/ControlPlaceholderCrash.zip)
Console log from crash:

```
ERROR: operator[]: Condition ' p_index<0 || p_index>=size() ' is true. returned: aux
   At: core/vector.h:128.
```

data.title: shader texscreen incorrectly documented
data.body: In the documentation it says `color texscreen( vec2 )` but it should be `vec3 texscreen(vec2)` as this function returns a `vec3`. I think it should actually return `color`, even tho' alpha will always be `1`. Makes things easier to work with it since you're looking for `color` and converting the `vec3` to it anyway...

data.title: ConcavePolygonShape2D crash when empty
Glitch playing SpatialStreamPlayer on top of Camera
data.body:
If a SpatialStreamPlayer has the exact same location as the Camera, the sound will not play. Instead we just hear a short noise.

Additional bug: having 5 (or more) SpatialStreamPlayers playing at the same time crashes the game without any errors. (I used autoplay, not sure if its the same if we play it manually, probably yes)

Sample scene attached
[sndtest.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/124686/sndtest.zip)

data.title: Mouse released immediately after dragging range property of ArrayPropertyEdit
data.body:
I could only reproduce this issue with range properties of ArrayPropertyEdit (I am not sure if this issue happen in other situations).
After dragging the spinbox and releasing the left mouse button, the mouse remains captured.

You can quickly check this with a Polygon2D node, by editing its polygon property (Vector2Array) and dragging the _Size_.

data.title: DIFFUSE usable from fragment shader
data.body:
Operating System: Ubuntu 15.10
Device: ASUS U31S
GPU: GeForce GT 520M, NVIDIA proprietary driver 352.63
GODOT version: 2.0 RC1 (09 FEB 2016)
### Steps to reproduce

Open up GODOT, create a `Sprite2D` node, add new material, add new `CanvasItemShader`, go to fragment and write `DIFFUSE = vec4(1,0,0,1) + vec4(1,1,1,1) * mod(TIME,1.0);` giving: `error(1,0): Nonexistent identifier in expression: DIFFUSE`. 

I see this is an older problem, but nobody checked it out: http://www.godotengine.org/topics/13145?board_id=11... or at least, I don't know what's happening, cause in a closed issues I've seen this `DIFFUSE` used (in a different problem: #912) and the guy wasn't complaining about it... so at that time it must have worked.

data.title: Options to make it easier to include/exclude folders on export.
data.body:
When you opt for select items to export, the export/bundle action should also be available for folder(in which case all sub folder content would be affected/included.

Having to manually include each file inside a given folder is a shore.

Also, as an alternative to that, when exporting all resources, it could be useful if folder wildcards like /assets/\* could also be used, along side extension wildcards like *.txt .

The main use for this is for making extra content packed into select .pcks, to be used later.(dlcs, expansions, etc.)

Having a decent select exporter could also make prototyping inside your main project a possibility, since its easy to decide what gets exported in the end.

data.title: Include search box in the Classes list window (Script editor)
data.body: When looking for Class info, I prefer to go to the "Search Help" button instead of the more logical "Classes", just because I can quickly type the name. Navigating the huge class tree takes longer. Would be great if we could add the same search box with auto-filter as we type.

data.title: Scripts should be scene identifiable
data.body:
There should be a way to tell which script belongs to which scene.
By opening a lot of scripts, after a while it gets messy what is from where.
Maybe a note at the bottom of the script window, like from objName, SceneName, or whatnot.

data.title: Editor GUI Text Controls Hide the Last Character
data.body:
Using Windows 10 and the rc1 version of 2.0

When using any of the editor controls that work with text the last character is hidden when the control is too small to show the last character, for instance, in the below image, you can see that the Path field is missing the final character in the path 'x', you also can't see my caret at this point, if I move the caret back a space it shows up properly in the field.

You should be able to reproduce this by clicking any text field and attempting to move the caret to the location following the final character.

![godottextboxlastcharactermissing](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17059062/12936104/13fd6f32-cf69-11e5-967b-3deb63d1b995.png)

data.title: Delete root node, undo issue
data.body:
Delete the root node of a scene and try to use undo(ctrl+z) -> Scene-View is not updating.
When you have a second Scene open, activate the second tab and Switch back to the first, now you can see the full tree again.

OS:Ubuntu 64-bit, XUbuntu

data.title: AnimationPlayer frame SpinBox snaps to steps.
data.body: This makes it so that using the frame # SpinBox aligns the cursor with a step if it was in-between steps from you playing/stopping. This makes it consistent whether 2D sprite image frames change when you step.

data.title: Add thumbnails for non-binary scene types
data.body: There are no thumbnails in the filesystem dock for non-binary scene files. Quickly finding scenes is much easier in grid mode with previews.

data.title: Disabling plugin not working
data.body:
There is a problem with Godot plugin menu as in RC 1.0; if you tick a plugin to use in Settings -> Editor Settings -> Plugins, it will enable the plugin on the main scene screen. But if you tick the plugin again so to disable it, the plugin will still be on the main scene. Enabling and Disabling repeatedly will just create more of the same plugin buttons on the main scene.

An image of the problem: http://imgur.com/a/cjKKf

I used Godot RC 1, in a Linux Mint. The plugin that I used was the Add_Primitives plugin (https://github.com/TheHX/add_primitives) - installing it manually on the .godot/plugin folder.

data.title: An option to automatically close dominant script on scene close
data.body:
There is an option to automatically open scene dominant script when user is opening new scene. I think it would be logical to allow editor close dominant script when user is closing the scene. Optionally editor can check if given script was opened automatically and close it only if this is true.
Update: **This issue is on how to make "open dominant script on scene change" option better.**

data.title: TileMap doesn't show most Sprite parameters
data.body:
It would be super awesome if when converting a scene to a tileset, Sprites retained all properties.
Things like modulate color, opacity, transforms, offset etc. 

The way TileMap works now limits its usefulness quite severely. It's easier to design levels just using the grid and scene instances. I think many users would agree with me that adding the ability to add scenes as tiles ( with scripts attached ) would help make things like doors, animated tiles etc much easier.
